intro: Astragalus dueluekensis, commonly known as the Dzüülek Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are compound, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
